CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON , a town in LOC of GPE .

CARDINAL . The applicant is a retired serviceman . In DATE when the applicant was still serving , his military unit signed a contract with a building enterprise of ORG for the construction of an apartment house for servicemen , the applicant included . In DATE the military unit was disbanded , and the applicant retired .

CARDINAL . Not having received the flat , the applicant sued the enterprise . On DATE the ORG ordered ORG to provide the applicant with a CARDINAL - room flat in the CARDINAL-apartment house no . DATE that was being constructed in GPE no . CARDINAL of PERSON . This judgment became binding on an unspecified date in DATE .

CARDINAL . In DATE the authority informed bailiffs that the construction had been delayed by a difficult socio - economic situation in the country . In DATE the authority informed the bailiffs that the construction would be finished during DATE .

CARDINAL . Frustrated with the delay , the applicant asked the court to change the mode of enforcement to a lump - sum payment of MONEY . The court refused that change because the applicant had failed to prove the impossibility of a literal enforcement . The court noted that the judgment had not specified a time frame for the provision of the flat , and that the construction was in progress . The court also noted that a lump - sum payment would have prejudiced other public expenditure .
